content:
The most common cause of folk posting questions like you have is because they have elected to use IMAP to manage their mail and the service provider either auto archives or deletes old mail after a set time frame. So can we start by confirming you are indeed using IMAP?

See https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/difference-between-imap-and-pop3

content:
From https://help.yahoo.com/kb/SLN36803.html?guccounter=1

"I access my Comcast.net email through a third-party email client (like Outlook or iOS Mail). Will I still be able to access my email this way after my account is moved?

Yes, but you'll need to complete your Comcast.net email move to Yahoo Mail first. Once you've accepted the Yahoo terms and have successfully signed in to your Comcast.net email at login.yahoo.com at least once, you'll then need to re-add your email account in the third-party email client using Yahoo Mail information."

incoming IMAP server: imap.mail.yahoo.com, 993, SSL/TLS, OAuth2 authentication, email address

outgoing SMTP server: smtp.mail.yahoo.com, 465, SSL/TLS, OAuth2 authentication, email address

I think you can just change the current settings if the account is already IMAP, not re-add it. Enter the account password in the OAuth window when asked for access; an app password is not necessary.

https://www.xfinity.com/support/articles/yahoo-email-migration-overview

content:
Hello there

You have to search for



Settings> general>when new message arrives> Check these boxes that are to be there for :

1.show an alert 2.show a tray icon. 3.play a sound.

By the way , also check that box : When thunderbird is minimised move it to the tray.


Also see for your window system :

Window taskbar settings.

1.Open Windows open windows taskbar, select taskbar settings. 2.go to personalisation > taskbar. 3.under notification area > click select which icons appear on the taskbar> or choose turn system icons on or off. 4. Make sure that thunderbird is turned on and that his icon is set to show.

For mac :

1.Open thunderbird 2.Go to menu that three striped hamburger 3.Go to settings >General tab scroll down to incoming mails or use the search bar to find when new message arrive 4.Use the system notifications must be checked. There you can choose for optimize for further instructions for what has to appear there in that message.


Greetings googlethunderbird. Happy christmas

content: Notifications on OS X are controlled in the OS system settings.
creator: sfhowes

content:
1.Configure thunderbird for system notifications :

1.open thunderbird. 2.click the menu > settings. 3.tab general 4.scroll down to incoming mails. 5. be sure the box next to show an alert is checked : show an alert. 6.you can choose for costumize for further. 7. Ensure the option to display an unread message icon on the taskbar/dock is also enabled within these settings if available in your current Thunderbird version.


2.configure mac os x system settings :

1.click on the apple menu choose for settings. 2. in the sidebar click for notifications. 3.on the right side in applications scroll down to thunderbird click on it. 4.next to the Allow notifications , toggle the switch to on. 5. Configure the other options to your preference, specifically. :


1.Alert style: Select Banners (temporary pop-ups) or Alerts (require dismissal).ðŸŽ… 2.Enable the Badges option to show the number of unread emails directly on the Thunderbird icon in your Dock.

After these setting you will receive new alert message s , and the wanted message of incoming email notification is in that icon in the apple mac dock.

creator: davidsk

content:
Hi Tim,

There are two places where you can control when messages are deleted from trash automatically:

  1. In Thunderbird account settings > Synchronization & Storage
  2. At your mail server

You'll want to check these settings.

Messages deleted from a trash folder are "permanently deleted". The only ways to get them back is from your own back-up copies and from your e-mail service provider, if they create back-ups for you. My e-mail service provider can restore "permanently deleted" messages within seven days of their deletion. Maybe yours can too.
creator: mozilla98

content:
my suggestion: - unsubscribe, shut down and restart thunderbird and resubscribe.

Personal suggestion: Allmail is a duplicate of al other folders. My suggestion is to remain unsubscribed. That cuts disk space in half, network traffic for sends and receives in half, and reduces computer resource use.

content:
There is neither a preview pane or a setting in the user interface for controlling animated GIFs. There is however a hidden preference media.autoplay.enabled that is inherited from Firefox that should stop the continuous play. This can be accessed in Thunderbird using the Config Editor

The trouble I am having is getting the acceptable values. Thankfully mozillazine was resurrected and this twenty year old article filled in the blanks. https://kb.mozillazine.org/Animated_images

Valid values are; 

       none â€” will prevent image animation        once â€” will let the image animate once        normal (default) â€” will allow it to play over and over

Note that case is important in text entered for this setting. It is all lower case. No capitalization.

content:
psmith4 said
New messages received by an email account are scattered at random in the inbox instead of being at the top of the list.
I sincerly beleive that there is nothing random about the arrengement at all.
How can I ensure that the inbox has new messages at the top?

Based on your description I think your are having issues understanding and managing threading and sorting in your folder display. Lin tells you haw to change to the table display and this I fully support as it makes threading intuitive something that does not happen in the "card view" which is the default.

If you go to setting and change your setting for threading to unthreaded you will probably revert to the decades old appearance of lists that you apparently are expecting.

Make sure to apply the change to existing folders. You would not be the first to make the change and fel it did not work because they did not select that option.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: Thanks, Matt. As you surmise, I was expecting the decades-old appearance of lists â€” unthreaded, sorted by descending date. This seems contrary to all Thunderbird defaults. Card view and threading were new concepts to me.
